page.title: 05HEM HEATH COLLIERY, BLURTON
page.content: Hem Heath pit is 1000 feet deep. Most of the coal produced is sold to the M.E.B. 1890 people work at Hem Heath, 360 work on the surface and 1530 work underground. Underground jobs include face workers and developing workers. On the surface there are fitters, electricians, coal washers and general maintenance staff. The men work shifts and they are paid according to how much coal they produce. Underground workers get more than surface workers because of the dangers. Less men are taken on in the pit than there used to be. Machinery has cut down employment opportunities. Only 20 men will be needed on a section that used to need 90. There is no Youth Training Scheme at the pit, and the easiest way to get a job is knowing someone at the pit.
